model_response: Absolutely. In the experimental arm, we will have three dose levels of HU6: 7.5 mg, 15 mg, and 30 mg. Subjects in this arm will follow a low-calorie diet for two days prior to enrollment and will continue with the low-calorie diet throughout the treatment period. After a two-day placebo run-in, they will receive an oral tablet of HU6 once daily for 6 months. This design will enable us to assess the safety, efficacy, and tolerability of different doses of HU6 in obese subjects with type 2 diabetes and NAFLD.

The placebo comparator arm, called "Placebo: Sugar Pill," will also include obese subjects with Type 2 Diabetes at risk of Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis. However, they will receive placebo instead of the active drug. This arm serves as a control group to compare the effects of HU6 with the placebo.
Yes, exactly! By including both active treatment with HU6 and the placebo comparator, we can assess the effectiveness of HU6 in improving liver fat content in individuals with Type 2 Diabetes.
